alert.note: Alert for Houston; Montgomery; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 7:44AM CDT until July 19 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following counties, Houston, Montgomery and Stewart. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Land Between the Lakes National Recreation Area, Saline Creek including Bumpus Mills, Dyers Creek including Big Rock, Lee Creek, North Cross Creek, Honey Fork Creek including Indian Mound, Hickman Creek including Dover, Lick Creek, Bellwood Branch, Cub Creek including Atkins, Long Creek, Cross Creek, and Elk Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dover, Erin, Tennessee Ridge, Big Rock, Cumberland City, Indian Mound, Woodlawn, Palmyra and Land Between The Lakes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
